cascom.jade.mtp.http
Class CascomGWConnectionManager

java.lang.Object
  cascom.jade.mtp.http.CascomGWConnectionManager

public class CascomGWConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object

Class for handling buffered connection between CASCOM Messaging Gateway and CASCOM Agent Platform. This class handles HTTP related issues related to the CASCOM message delivery between client and the gateway. Those issues concern message numbering, buffering, error-detection and closing the connection properly. Class will inform attached ConnectionListener when connection is closed.

Author:
Ahti Syreeni - TeliaSonera

Constructor Detail

CascomGWConnectionManager

public CascomGWConnectionManager(int bufferSize,
                                 boolean isClient)
Creates a new instance of CascomGWConnectionManager for client side. The input and outputs must be opened, this class does not deal with opening the streams. However, it notifies the attached ConnectionListener if the streams are closed because of an error, also the streams can be requested to be closed with closeStreams() method.

Method Detail

setResponseTimeOut

public void setResponseTimeOut(int timeout)
Sets timeout for server response. If the receiver does not respond before that timeout, the sender will assume that receiver is dead.

Parameters:
timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.

setClosingTimeout

public void setClosingTimeout(int timeout)
If this is the client side (not the gateway side), this is the way to change the timeout for closing the connection to the CASCOM Messaging gateway when there haven't been any transmissions between client and gateway for a while. By default, this functionality is off. If the timeout is set to Integer.MAX_VALUE, the options is turned off.

Parameters:
timeout - The timeout for closing connection to the gateway in SECONDS.

setPingingTimeout

public void setPingingTimeout(int timeout)
Sets pinging timeout. After timeout one byte will be sent to the output to make sure that connection is not broken if there is not traffic. This is the only way to check that connection is really alive.

Parameters:
timeout - the Timeout for pinging in SECONDS.

getAckNumber

public int getAckNumber(int receivedMsgNumber)
Returns the ack number for given message number. It is usually the same as the message number but if the connection has already received more packages, the ack number is greater. Calling this method will register the given message number as received. Note that the incoming messages are not buffered.

deliver

public void deliver(HTTPAddress host,
                    FipaHttpObject httpObject)
             throws jade.mtp.MTPException
Delivers requests, should not be used for responses or other objects that are not meant to be buffered

Throws:
jade.mtp.MTPException

isSending

public boolean isSending()
Returns true if there is transmission going on to from this side to the other side of the connection.

deliver

public void deliver(FipaHttpObject httpObject)
             throws jade.mtp.MTPException
Delivers the message using the default host specified with setDefaultHost -method.

Throws:
jade.mtp.MTPException

setDefaultHost

public void setDefaultHost(HTTPAddress hta)
Specifies the default host which will be used as destination host if no other host is specified when delivering the message.

handleHttpRequest

public void handleHttpRequest(FipaHttpObject fho)
Handles the connection related HTTP requests. If this is the server side of the connection, the server will send HTTP-response with connection-close to client and closes the output connection or only sends HTTP-response, if the initial request is not request to close the connection. If this is the client side of the connection, the client refuses to close the connection even if the server asks because server is just checking if the client is still alive.

getDefaultHost

public HTTPAddress getDefaultHost()

handleHttpResponse

public void handleHttpResponse(FipaHttpObject ro)

messageDelivered

public void messageDelivered(FipaHttpObject fho)
Inform sender with HTTP response that the message is parsed and delivered to the agent platform without errors.

undeliveredMessage

public void undeliveredMessage(FipaHttpObject ro)
The specified message cannot be delivered because it contains error specified in FipaHttpObject.getErrorMsg() - string.

closeConnection

public void closeConnection()
This method can be requested by the ConnectionManager, to close the current connection clean, that is, the http-request close is sent to the other end of the connection. The output direction will be immediately closed after sending the request.

closeOutput

protected void closeOutput(java.lang.String msg)

connectionClosed

public boolean connectionClosed()

closeOutput

protected void closeOutput()

startSending

public boolean startSending(java.io.OutputStream output,
                            ConnectionListener cl,
                            FipaHttpObject initRequest)
Sets new InputStream and OutputStream to be used with this manager. Streams must be open for reading and writing. This method will also try to send next message in buffer if such exist.

getLatestMessageSentIndex

public int getLatestMessageSentIndex()

hasBufferedMessages

public boolean hasBufferedMessages()
Returns true if there are one or more messages waiting in buffer to be delivered.

readError

public void readError(FipaHttpObject fho,
                      java.io.IOException e)
Method for server side to inform this connection manager that IOException has occured. This connection manager reacts by trying to close the duplex socket if the connection is closed or sends error message back if the response is expected.

releaseResources

public void releaseResources()
Release resources, this instance should not be used after calling this method.
